title: Yorkshire dialect
summary: The Yorkshire dialect (also known as Broad Yorkshire, Tyke, Yorkie or Yorkshire English) is a dialect, or continuum of dialects, spoken in the Yorkshire region of Northern England.[1] The dialect has roots in Old English and is influenced by Old Norse. The Yorkshire dialect has faded and faces extinction,[2][3] but organisations such as The Yorkshire Dialect Society and the East Riding Dialect Society exist to promote its use.
